HiReel - Redefining Sharing on YouTube

Changing the way people share on YouTube

CLIENT UNIVERSITY PROJECT

THE CHALLENGE

YouTube has many ways to share videos to people. Some people only use one form of it. Some never use the alternative means of sharing videos.

RESULTS

Audience feedback revealed people would share more because the solution gave many options to share and made it easy.

Research - Why New Ways of Sharing on YouTube?

We did interviews with 6 people to understand how they use YouTube and what techniques they utilise to share videos among friends.

People are not familiar or rarely use inherent share in YouTube

People share videos by copying address bar URL but it breaks continuity and takes them to other platforms

Most of the popular chat apps do not have integration with YouTube directly on web

User Needs and Characteristics

Many people do not know or recognise YouTube native sharing feature on the website

Most prople like to share videos on messaging apps to their friends and family but are limited by current options on the web

Some people predominantly use mobile while others use the webs version. Sharing features on both platforms are different

Design Concept


Re-imagine video as a sharing space while offering personalised sharing options.
Design Concept

Video Prototype

Wizard of Oz style prototype method. We chose this method for its simplicity and to create a quick prototype for a 1 week bootcamp scenario

Future Directions

People want to be able to share videos without going to other platforms

A customized friends list is desirable to share with select number of people on certain platform

The HiReel â€“ It could be evolved into a Co-Watch experience. One can view videos and collaborate simultaneously online, just like a family seeing TV together

Isolated shared space to different highlights - can others edit the highlights of other friends or not?
